content.description: Lie back or jam the short and sweet fist/off width crack.
content.protection: 2 #4's The updated guide book indicates a horizontal halfway up that takes a #3, but I didn't see it.    Bolt anchors with rap rings
content.location: From the standard approach head right, towards the seasonal water fall, continue until you see the perfect crack created by big flake, it's hard to miss. Directly right of Panning for Gold.

content.description: Climb easily up a low angled face of the leaning flake to the overhanging face with 3 bolts. Crank through crimps to really good holds then do it again. Cruise to the anchors. Stout little 10a but well worth doing. You'll be glad you did it.
content.location: Located at the far left end of Cave Creek near where the access trail comes down. There is a large low angled flake at the base of the route. Its the 3rd route in the guide book.

content.description:
First ascents seem like panning for gold.  Sometimes you can strike it rich, but most of the time you just end up with a handful of dirt. 

  Climb the left angling crack 15 feet to a sloping.  Traverse left, then climb up into the right angling layback crack/arete thingie.  Climb this feature 20 feet to a ledge.  Now follow the 2-3" crack up and right to the top.
content.location: Just around the corner right of Burly Bulges, this starts between the two large rocks in the trail and the tree.

climbs.name: Hairless Wonder
climbs.fa: Clay Frisbie, Woody Delp, Tom Hancock

content.description: Start on the large flake and follow it until it peters out.  Move through the strenuous but short face section then continue up the crack to the top.  Make an easy traverse out left to use the anchors on top of Sunshine Divine.
content.protection: SR to a #1 Camalot.  Tree anchor or traverse to Sunshine Divine's bolted anchor
content.location: Look for an area with 2 large opposing flakes.  This one starts on the right flake.

content.description:
Climb the crack through 3 bulges, the last feeling the hardest to me. 

  The split rating is due to height.  If you're tall enough to reach out right from the 1st flared handjam this will feel easier.  If not, you have to use another flared jam above the 1st which is not quite as good.
content.protection: Pro to 2", doubles from .75-2" might be useful. Bring a few slings for chickenheads above the last bulge. Tree anchor/rap.
content.location: After hiking south past the huge overhang area and a bouter near the trail, begin looking for a crack going through 3 bulges.

content.description:
Mix of crack and face climbing on south and east facing sandstone.

 This the area West of the Gravity Slab area. Â All of the routes here exist between the dog walk approach and the standard downclimb approach. Receives mixed sun and shade throughout the day.
